title: parseDateString function receive modelValue
uib-timepicker inconsistent disabled inputs with min and max times
body:
### Bug description:
A uib-timepicker with a max time disables the input field when the up spinner button is disabled, while a timepicker with a min time does not disable the input field when the down spinner button is disabled.
This is an issue when the time is set to now and the max is also set to now. The user cannot tab to the input field to change it. Their only option is to hit the down spinner button.

bootstrap/template/timepicker/timepicker.html:
`<input type="text" placeholder="HH" ng-model="hours" ng-change="updateHours()" class="form-control text-center" ng-readonly="::readonlyInput" maxlength="2" tabindex="{{::tabindex}}" ng-disabled="noIncrementHours()" ng-blur="blur()">`

The input field is disabled based only on if they are not able to increment the hours. Is this designed behavior? 

### Link to minimally-working plunker that reproduces the issue:
https://plnkr.co/edit/iOCOW1sQjM0EG1YS9Tc5?p=preview

### Version of Angular, UIBS, and Bootstrap
Angular: 1.5.8
UIBS: 2.3.0
Bootstrap: 3.3.7

title: feat(position): add 'positionElementAt' method
body:
Add a method to position an element at client x/y coordinates. Using
code from the positionElements method, which has been refactored into a
positionElement method with both positionElementAt and positionElements
use.

title: Update dependencies
body:
The current versions are not secure: https://david-dm.org/angular-ui/bootstrap?type=dev
Except the karma upgrade nothing should break the build/test.

title: multiple uib-dropdown components keyboard-nav issue
body:
### Bug description: If there are multiple uib-dropdown components in a single page with keyboard-nav enabled, clicking on second dropdown while first dropdown still open breaks keyboard navigation for the second dropdown.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Open the link to plunker provided.
2. Click on first dropdown and check keyboard navigation which is working fine.
3. Without closing the first dropdown, click on second dropdown and check keyboard navigation for this.

Expected: When down arrow is pressed, 'Action' option should be selected.

Actual: 'Another action' option is selected.

After that, the keyboard navigation is not working as expected for all the dropdowns.

Note that this issue is similar to [#6314](https://github.com/angular-ui/bootstrap/issues/6314). While it talks only about a keyboard-nav enabled dropdown and a non keyboard-nav enabled dropdown, the current issue talks about keyboard navigation issue in multiple dropdown components in a single page.

PS: Tried incorporating [#6314](https://github.com/angular-ui/bootstrap/issues/6314)'s fix to check if it fixes the current issue. But when that fix is added, the second dropdown keyboard navigation is not triggered at all.

### Link to minimally-working plunker that reproduces the issue:

https://plnkr.co/edit/kGDpkqYPdY5B4RPxAxB8?p=preview

### Version of Angular, UIBS, and Bootstrap

Angular: 1.5.8

UIBS: 2.3.0

Bootstrap: 3.3.7

title: dropdowns won't close when parent stops event propagation
body:
The issues forum is __NOT__ for support requests. It is for bugs and feature requests only.
Please read https://github.com/angular-ui/bootstrap/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md and search
existing issues (both open and closed) prior to opening any new issue and ensure you follow the instructions therein.

### Bug description:
I got a wrapper that stops event propagation. In that wrapper I got several directives with UI Bootstrap dropdowns. 

The problem is, that these dropdowns doesn't close on any click. Only by clicking another dropdown.

Seems UI dropdown watches body or something to force closing.

Bootstrap:
1.3.3

title: Some code is dead
body:
In angular-ui-bootstrap@2.2.0, it appears that there is some dead code. When running it through the Webpack UglifyJS plugin, I got the following warnings:

```
Dropping unused function getSlideByIndex [./~/angular-ui-bootstrap/dist/ui-bootstrap-tpls.js:620,0]
Dropping unused variable lastActivated [./~/angular-ui-bootstrap/dist/ui-bootstrap-tpls.js:1345,0]
Dropping unused variable dataPerTracked [./~/angular-ui-bootstrap/dist/ui-bootstrap-tpls.js:1337,0]
Dropping unused function cameltoDash [./~/angular-ui-bootstrap/dist/ui-bootstrap-tpls.js:3001,0]
Dropping unused variable cache [./~/angular-ui-bootstrap/dist/ui-bootstrap-tpls.js:2726,0]
Dropping unused variable selectedOption [./~/angular-ui-bootstrap/dist/ui-bootstrap-tpls.js:3263,0]
```

Manually spot-checking some of these in the file does indeed suggest that the code is unused.

The short-term fix is to remove the dead code. The longer-term fix is to add `no-undef` to the `.eslintrc`, so these errors can be caught. I'm happy to do either if you express interest in such a PR :smile:.

title: Datepicker doesn't scroll itself on Firefox (but does on Chrome)
body:
### Bug description:
If you're precise, the scroll behavior on the opening of the datepicker doesn't work. It works though if it just at the right point. Better show as an example:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/nylpria6l7yh5kl/Screenshot%202016-11-18%2018.27.09.png?dl=0 this is initial state
https://www.dropbox.com/s/4cgofq51yfxwlha/Screenshot%202016-11-18%2018.27.13.png?dl=0 this is what you get, when you click on it, so scroll doesn't happen (and it does on Chrome for instance)

However, this way it does work:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/egm2n95xeu2c2n3/Screenshot%202016-11-18%2018.32.02.png?dl=0 -- initial state
https://www.dropbox.com/s/4sk1molk25gczq8/Screenshot%202016-11-18%2018.32.06.png?dl=0 -- scroll happened after click

Or if you prefer gifs -- https://www.dropbox.com/s/3dlm417iw7r5a4c/ff-datepicker-aub.gif?dl=0

Sorry if it's too hard to understand what I mean, if you need more examples, than tell me and I'll try to show it in some other way. Also I didn't find such an issue, either opened or closed. Also I may dig deeper, if you confirm this :)
### Link to minimally-working plunker that reproduces the issue:
https://plnkr.co/edit/0qj0wOPrMx8BRTlV6c31?p=preview, this is a standard one from https://angular-ui.github.io/bootstrap/#/datepicker

50 (and lower as well)
Angular:
1.5.8
UIBS:
2.2.0
Bootstrap:
3.3.7

title: uib-carousel : deleting a slide causes incorrect indexing of active slide
body:
### Bug description:

Deleting a slide incorrectly indexes the `active` variable passed to the `uib-carousel` directive.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Stay on the first slide
2. Click `Remove slide`

**_Observed_**

The `active` index which is passed in from the controller is set one. 

NOTE: You seem to be able to click through the deck for awhile but eventually it gets stuck which is probably due to the active index getting out of sync.

**_Expected_**

I'd expect that the `active` index should be set to zero when the first slide has been deleted.

If my assumptions are incorrect, apologies, but I read through the documentation/bugs and couldn't find a resolution.

### Link to minimally-working plunker that reproduces the issue:

https://plnkr.co/edit/CDKUwpbJ9iHaurGHVL1Z?p=preview

### Version of Angular, UIBS, and Bootstrap

Angular: **1.5.8**
UIBS:  **2.2.0**
Bootstrap: **3.3.7**

title: uib-dropdown - ontoggle event not fired with multiple dropdowns on one page
body:
When I have two dropdowns on the same page, both of which are using the on-toggle event, only one of them is called when i use the other dropdown to close the first.

In this plunker, open up your console and try this:

1, click dropdown1 to open it.  you'll see an event logged "dropdown1 open"
2. click dropdown1 to close it.  you'll see an event logged "dropdown1 closed"
3, click dropdown2 to open it.  you'll see an event logged "dropdown2 open"
4. click dropdown2 to close it.  you'll see an event logged "dropdown2 closed"
5, now click dropdown1 to open it.  you'll see an event logged "dropdown1 open"
4. click dropdown2 while dropdown1 is still open.  dropdown2 will open and dropdown1 will close but notice that the events only show the dropdown1 messages.  Since I'm doing other things in my on-toggle event, this is causing me a problem (and my users actually have to triple click the dropdown to get it to open)

http://plnkr.co/edit/SuaxVHxf84QG8KFFbvhY?p=preview

title: aria-expanded="true/false" should be on button that triggers the action
body:
### Bug description:
The aria-expanded attribute with true/false values should be on the button the triggers the action. Currently it's on the parent DIV of the content expanding/collapsing. It will therefore not be picked up by screen readers and assistive software. This has been tested in JAWS 17 and NVDA 2016

It should be moved to the button:
`eg: <button aria-expanded="true/false">Toggle Collapse</button>`

You can also see examples of how it should be done on the W3C site - it's a part of the toggle link
**[W3C site example](https://www.w3.org/WAI/GL/wiki/Using_aria-expanded_to_indicate_the_state_of_a_collapsible_element)**

### Link to minimally-working plunker that reproduces the issue:
This can be found on the example site, just inspect the HTML for either of the collapse button examples: 
[https://angular-ui.github.io/bootstrap/#/collapse](https://angular-ui.github.io/bootstrap/#/collapse)

### Version of Angular, UIBS, and Bootstrap

Angular:
1.5.8
UIBS:
2.2.0
Bootstrap:
3.3.7

title: date-picker-popup: model isn't changed when format has only 2 year digits and only century changes
body:
### Bug description:
When date format is set to smth like 'M/d/yy' (e.g. 'shortDate' for US) and user changes only year to other century keeping day and month, the model is not changed.

### Link to minimally-working plunker that reproduces the issue:
http://plnkr.co/edit/rAM3qyyQPOySCioJ1ngM?p=preview
Initial date is set to Feb 1st, 1917. In the textbox it's displayed as 2/1/17. Model value is displayed at the top (consider your current timezone).

Bring up the popup calendar clicking on button to the right, sequentially choose year '2017' - month 'February' - date '1' in order to set date to Feb 1st, 2017. You can see that model isn't changed actually. I believe it's because the text representation is the same.

### Version of Angular, UIBS, and Bootstrap
Angular: 1.5
UIBS: 2.2.0

title: Conditional expression inside custom template in order to make the particular list item unselectable
body:
Hi All,

I am using uib-typeahead to show nested structure (flattening it to array). In this I wanted to make all the parent with child as non selectable and should be skipped when navigating from keyboard. And all children can be selectable so did put inside tag. In order to achieve this functionality, I put around ng-if statement on a tag and check whether it has children flag set or not. If it does have children property set, then skip the tag and go into div tag and check property. Now the tree structure is defined, uib-typeahead-ediatble is set to false, ui-typeahead-on-select it also set. But navigation using keyboard is weird as it does not skip all element list defined through DIV tag. And if I remove ng-if statements on and DIV tag, all list items are populated twice but keyboard navigation works only for element defined through tag.
Wanted to understand, whether this is a feature desgined or missing feature ? I tried using typeahead-group header class but that will also involve conditions on a tag which again does not work.

title: Tooltip not shown for divs within ng-repeat
body:
I'm trying to show a tooltip on some divs of a website using AngularUI. The goal is to show them already when the user enters the site. That's why tooltop-is-open is set to true right from the beginning. However, this does not work for elements within a repeating group (i.e. divs created via ng-repeat). 

Link to plunkr: [https://plnkr.co/edit/m4Gd1b9CCpzdrIIJoOw3?p=preview](https://plnkr.co/edit/m4Gd1b9CCpzdrIIJoOw3?p=preview)

On [SO](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/40338916/tooltip-of-angularui-not-shown-for-divs-within-ng-repeat/40341788#40341788), one made the suggestion to use uib-tooltip-html instead. However, this only worked in the modified plunkr. Locally, even though the tooltips are shown, they are empty.

The issues forum is __NOT__ for support requests. It is for bugs and feature requests only.
Please read https://github.com/angular-ui/bootstrap/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md and search
existing issues (both open and closed) prior to opening any new issue and ensure you follow the instructions therein.

Versions:
- Angular 1.5.8
- UIBS 2.2.0
- Bootstrap 3.3.7 (CSS only)

This issue happens in **IE10**, Chrome is correct. Angular: v1.4.0-rc.2 UIBS: 1.3.3 - 2016-05-22 Bootstrap: v3.3.5 Here is my code: ```

title: fix(modal): backdrops for appendTo (modal in modal)
body:
Modals couldn't be used in modals (open a modal in a modal) and other containers. A new backdrop is now created on each appendTo element which is used in the app. If a backdrop exist on a element it is reused and the backdrop index is increase (old behavoir). To recognize which element has already a backdrop appended, a data-backtrop attribute is written on the related element. 

Closes #6219 and #2678 is also related

body:
